name: NixOS (Unstable)
install_guide_markdown:
# NixOS Installation Guide

## Prerequisites
- Familiarity with declarative configuration
- 2GB RAM minimum
- 20GB disk space
- Understanding of functional package management

## Step 1: Download ISO
Get minimal or GNOME-based ISO from nixos.org/download

## Step 2: Boot Live System
Boot from ISO and access TTY

## Step 3: Partition and Format Disk
Use `parted` or `fdisk` to partition disk, then format with ext4/btrfs

## Step 4: Mount and Generate Config
Mount root partition and run `nixos-generate-config --root /mnt`

## Step 5: Edit Configuration
Edit `/mnt/etc/nixos/configuration.nix` for packages and settings

## Step 6: Install
Run `nixos-install` to build and install system

install_steps.title: Download NixOS ISO
install_steps.detail_md: Choose between minimal (700MB) for CLI or GNOME (3.2GB) for desktop environment.

install_steps.title: Partition Disk
install_steps.detail_md:
Boot live system and use `parted` or `fdisk` to create partitions. Example:
```
parted /dev/sda mklabel gpt
parted /dev/sda mkpart primary ext4 1MB 512MB
parted /dev/sda mkpart primary ext4 512MB 100%
```

install_steps.title: Format Partitions
install_steps.detail_md:
Format partitions with ext4 or btrfs:
```
mkfs.ext4 /dev/sda1
mkfs.ext4 /dev/sda2
```

install_steps.title: Mount Filesystem
install_steps.detail_md:
Mount root and boot partitions:
```
mount /dev/sda2 /mnt
mkdir /mnt/boot
mount /dev/sda1 /mnt/boot
```

install_steps.title: Edit Configuration
install_steps.detail_md:
Edit `/mnt/etc/nixos/configuration.nix` to customize:
- Hostname
- System packages
- Users
- Services
- Desktop environment

install_steps.title: Install NixOS
install_steps.detail_md:
Build and install NixOS:
```
nixos-install
```
This may take 10-30 minutes depending on packages.
